intro: Ebenus sumatrana, commonly known as the Sumatran Ebenus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Sumatra. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, umbel-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands. It has a taproot system and is often found in humid tropical climates. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
